ai.summary: An easy 3.8 km out-and-back hike in the UK to Duchess Cave and Cave Crag. The route winds through woodland to a dramatic cave and crag overlook, with a waterfall feature along the way. Suitable for families and beginners seeking a relaxed day outdoors with scenic rewards.
ai.terrain_summary: The route mixes well-defined forest paths with damp, rocky sections near the cave. Expect uneven footing, slippery surfaces when wet, and a cave floor that may be wet and uneven. There are short rises near the crag and some exposed rock surfaces.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and cave conditions before you go. Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear and bring a warm, waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths; be cautious of slippery rock, damp cave floors, and loose stones near the crag. Carry a light source for the cave and extra batteries. Keep children close, and avoid peak crowds or closures. Mobile signal may be limited in remote sections.
recommended_gear: Sturdy, waterproof footwear with good grip
Warm layers and a waterproof jacket
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Snack and a small first-aid kit
Map, compass, or offline GPS; fully charged phone as backup
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn are ideal for this hike, with peak waterfall views after rainfall. If visiting in winter, be prepared for ice and reduced accessibility and check local conditions.

seo.title: Duchess Cave and Cave Crag – Easy 3.8 km Hike in the UK with Waterfalls
seo.meta_description: Discover Duchess Cave and Cave Crag on an easy 3.8 km hike in the UK. Learn terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and gear for a scenic waterfall-filled adventure.
